title: Police register trespass case at Kochi stadium amid political controversy over Messi’s team visit

title: Lack of accessible toilets in Chennai leaves persons with disabilities in distress

title: Congress against Assam's development, wants youths to join militancy, alleges Himanta

content: Warangal Mayor Gundu Sudharani said around 45 localities under the Greater Warangal Municipal Corporation limits were flooded, prompting the administration to initiate large-scale evacuation and rehabilitation measures.

title: Pune-based gangster Ghaywal is in London, confirms U.K. High Commission
content: We have received a reply from the High Commission. They have confirmed that Ghaywal is in London and is currently on a visitor visa. They also confirmed that he is in London to see his son, says  Deputy Commissioner of Police Sambhaji Kadam

title: NDA, LDF look to breach UDF fort in Chengannur
content: Over the past two decades, the UDF has largely held sway over the civic body, spending only a brief period in the opposition. The UDF secured victories in the local body elections of 2010, 2015, and 2020

title: Urdu is the most beautiful language, says Kiren Rijiju

content: Himanta Biswa Sarma alleged that singing the anthem was the Opposition party’s  endorsement of the claim by a section of leaders in Bangladesh that the entire northeast region is part of the neighbouring nation

title: Row intensifies over death of person over NRC fears in WB, Trinamool announces protest
content: Trinamool Congress general secretary Abhishek Banerjee told the people that if they see BJP leaders they should,  “tie them up and tell them they will be let go once they produce their father’s and grandfather’s certificates”.

title: 2-day online camp offers positivity skill training for teens

title: Cyber thieves outpace banks’ response time in cybercrime cases
content: While some bank officials, fully aware of the Reserve Bank of India’s guidelines on customer liability, attempt to shift responsibility, others end up misleading victims, at times even advising them to change their registered mobile numbers, instead of taking immediate remedial action.

title: M.B. Patil blames Centre’s incentives to Andhra Pradesh for Google setting up AI data centre in Visakhapatnam
content: Minister for Large and Medium Industries M.B. Patil has blamed the Centre’s incentives to Andhra Pradesh behind Google’s choice for setting up its AI Data Centre in Visakhapatnam

title: Indian IT industry big contributor to business-driven air travel and carbon footprint: Report
content: Enforcing sustainable travel policies such as flying economy, choosing non-stop flights, trains or buses, and capping frequent flyer trips are among the recommendations made to IT companies in a report on the ‘Urgency and Potential of Aviation Impact Mitigation In India’

title: Karnataka govt. mulls law to implement internal reservation
content: The Karnataka Scheduled Castes (Sub-classification) Bill, 2025, which is ready, will be piloted in the winter session of the legislature

title: Cyclone Montha: DISCOMs incur loss of ₹17.84 crore on account of damages to infra

title: Bengaluru start-ups captured a whopping $38 bn from VCs during 2020-24: Priyank Kharge

title: Netizens hail MLA’s proud post on wife’s achievement

title: District-level panel to examine complaints on waste treatment factory

content: Rolled out by Local Self-Governments department and General Education department, it aims at nurturing ecologically sensible citizens

title: Cyclone Montha leaves 2 dead, flattens crops in A.P.

title: Sizeable number of militants neutralised during Operation Sindoor: Rajnath
content: Defence Minister praises Prime Minister Narendra Modi for restoring India’s pride and stature on the global stage. He says the Opposition’s election promise of providing a government job to every household is unrealistic and misleading.

title: Karnataka High Court directs KEA not to finalise third round allotment of seats to medical and dental courses for now

title: Political parties reiterate their opinion on SIR at meeting chaired by CEO

title: Supreme Court decides to examine reasons behind chronic delay in trial courts to frame charges, links it to pendency
content: Section 251 (1) (b) of the Bharatiya Nagarik Suraksha Sanhita (BNSS) mandates that charges must be framed within 60 days in cases triable by a Court of Session

title: Congress accuses Modi government of reviving Manusmriti principles in labour policy

title: 1.3 million vehicles hit Hyderabad IT corridor despite continuous rain; staggered work hours help avert gridlock

title: Draft DPR for ORR facelift ready: Features 10-lane road, bus priority corridor, cycling lanes

title: Cyclone Montha: 13.56 lakh power consumers affected in 11 districts, ₹10.47 cr. loss incurred by APEPDCL

title: Central Pay Commission’s terms of reference rigid: AITUC general secretary

title: Developing countries need 12 times more funds than currently available to tackle climate crisis

Prasad (CPI),  Law Minister P.Rajeeve (CPI-M), Electricity Minister K. Krishnankutty (Janata Dal-Secular), Water Resources Minister Roshy Augustine (Kerala Congress-M) and Forest Minister A.K. Saseendran (Nationalist Congress Party)

title: Priyanka seeks ST status for Kalanadi community
content: The MP raises the demand citing the Kalanadi community’s social, economic, and geographical backwardness, along with their declining population of just 328 members

title: Paddy farmers worried as cyclone devastates crops in Krishna
content: According to preliminary crop damage report, standing paddy crops on 45,040 hectares, blackgram on 985 hectares, groundnut on 288.2 hectares and cotton on all 43 hectares have been damaged

title: Jays ride Yesavage's record 12 K's to cusp of title

title: Dodgers' bats flail again, putting season on brink

content: The Twins are turning to Derek Shelton to be their new manager, sources confirmed to ESPN on Wednesday.

title: La. Gov.: LSU AD won't select new football coach

content: Emma Sears scored a hat trick as the United States closed out the October window with a one-sided 6-0 win over New Zealand on Wednesday in Kansas City, Missouri.

content: Brad Marchand is stepping away from the Panthers to help coach a junior hockey team in place of friend JP MacCallum, whose daughter died last week of cancer.

title: Fake Scientist Arrested In Mumbai, Likely Had Access To Nuclear Data
content: In a crucial development after the arrest of a fake scientist at the country's premier nuclear research unit, Bhabha Atomic Research Centre (BARC), Mumbai police have recovered suspicious nuclear data and 14 maps from the suspect.

title: Andhra Chief Minister Says 2 Killed Following Cyclone Montha's Landfall
content: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu said on Wednesday that two people had been killed after Cyclone Montha made landfall in the state.

title: US-China Sign 1-Year Deal On Rare Earths, Trump Rates Xi Meet "12 On 10"
content: US President Donald Trump on Thursday said he and his Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping have agreed for a one year deal on rare earths, following a nearly two-hour meeting in South Korea.

title: Prank Or Provocation? Wi-Fi ID Of Bank In Karnataka Changed To 'Pak Zindabad'
content: A police case has been filed in Karnataka after the Wi-Fi network of a bank popped up as "Pakistan Zindabad." The changed name showed up in the Wi-Fi connection of a bank in Bengaluru Urban district.

title: Mohammad Azharuddin Set To Join Telangana Cabinet As Minister Tomorrow
content: Former Indian cricket captain and senior Congress leader Mohammad Azharuddin is poised to join the Telangana Cabinet as a minister on Friday, marking his formal entry into the state government.

title: Video: Bengaluru Couple Chases Biker For 2 km After Minor Accident, Kills Him
content: Bengaluru saw yet another road rage horror after a couple killed a man over a minor crash last week. The accused have been arrested by the police.

title: Donald Trump, Xi Jinping Meeting LIVE Updates: Trump To Visit China In April, Cuts Fentanyl-Related Tariffs To 10%
content: Trump-Xi Meeting LIVE Updates: The meeting, which took place on the sidelines of the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) summit, came amid the ongoing trade war between Beijing and US.

title: Congress Braces For Treason Charge As Bangladesh Anthem Row Heightens
content: The controversy over a Congress district-level leader reciting Bangladesh's national anthem has heightened, with the Assam government taking legal action over what it claims is an endorsement of narratives from across the border.

title: "He Was Murdered": Mother Of Teen Killed in Rio Raids, Death Count At 119
content: The head, its hair dyed red, was severed from the body and found in dense vegetation near a Rio favela, some 24 hours after Brazil's deadliest-ever police operation. It belonged to 19-year-old Iago Ravel.

title: Google's Alphabet Reports First-Ever $100 Billion Quarterly Revenue Due To AI
content: Google parent Alphabet reported its first-ever $100 billion quarterly revenue on Wednesday, powered by strong growth across its core search business and rapidly expanding cloud division that was buoyed by artificial intelligence.

title: "Will Have Fantastic Ties": Trump Meets Xi Jinping Amid Trade Tensions
content: President Donald Trump on Thursday said he will have a "fantastic relationship" with his Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping, as the two leaders met face-to-face after six years in South Korea amid major tensions between the two countries.

title: Hurricane Melissa Made 4 Times More Likely Due To Climate Change: Study
content: Hurricane Melissa, which struck Jamaica as one of the most powerful storms ever recorded, was made four times more likely because of human-caused climate change, a rapid analysis said Wednesday.

title: Two Suspects Admit Involvement In $102 Million Louvre Jewel Heist
content: Two suspects in the Louvre jewel heist on Wednesday were handed preliminary charges of criminal conspiracy and theft committed by an organised gang, according to the Paris prosecutor's office. The prosecutor said they admitted their involvement.

title: Video: Flamingos Arrive In Tamil Nadu's Thoothukudi For Winter Stay
content: Every year, at the onset of winter, an extraordinary spectacle eagerly awaited by bird watchers takes place along the coastal regions of Thoothukudi district - the arrival of flamingos.

title: Young Americans Hesitate To Have Children Over Climate Change Fears: Study
content: Younger generations of Americans are increasingly citing climate change as making them reticent to have children, according to several studies.

title: Video: Drunk Teacher Drags Biker For 1.5 km With Car In Gujarat Hit-And-Run
content: Two people were injured after their motorcycle was hit and dragged for more than a kilometre by a car that was driven by a drunk teacher, in a shocking case of hit-and-run in Gujarat recently.

title: Delhi's Air Quality Continues To Remain In 'Very Poor' Category
content: Delhi woke up to a hazy morning on Thursday, with the city's air quality remaining in the 'very poor' category at 352, as of 8 am.

title: Poll Body Launches Helpline To Clear Voters' Doubts Ahead Of SIR In Bengal
content: To maintain transparency and clarify doubts among people regarding the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of electoral rolls in West Bengal, the Election Commission (EC) has launched voter helpline 1950, an official said.

title: RSS Gets Go-Ahead For March On Congress Chief's Turf, But With Riders
content: The march will begin from Narendra Rathod Layout and pass through Samrat Circle, Basaveshwara Circle, Hanuman Temple, and Kumbara Wadi, before concluding at the designated point, according to the officials.

title: Class 8 Girl Kidnapped, Gang-Raped By 4 Men Inside Vehicle In Faridabad
content: A 15-year-old girl was allegedly kidnapped and raped by four youths in their car here, police said on Tuesday.

title: Two arrested for cyberfraud
content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . first day first show news and reviews from the world of cinema and streaming . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in!

title: Delivery boy chased, crushed after Bengaluru road rage spat; couple arrested for murder
content: A Kalaripayattu trainer and his wife have been arrested for deliberately running over a 24-year-old food delivery agent in Bengaluru. CCTV footage revealed the couple intentionally rammed the agent's scooter after a minor brush, then returned to collect broken car parts. The victim died from his injuries.

title: From rare earths to tariff cuts- Trump, Xi discuss trade: Key decisions made
content: US President Trump and Chinese President Xi Jinping held crucial talks, leading to tariff reductions on Chinese goods and fentanyl. China will immediately resume significant soybean purchases, signaling a potential turning point in trade relations. Trump expressed optimism, rating the meeting highly and hinting at a diplomatic reset with a future visit to China.

title: Watch: Drunk teacher in Gujarat drives 750m with motorcyclist on hood after crash
content: A shocking incident unfolded on the Modasa-Lunawada highway where a drunk driver dragged a man on his car's hood for 750 meters with the victim's motorcycle lodged in the fender. Alerted by another motorist, the car was stopped, and the injured were hospitalized. The driver, a teacher, faces severe charges including attempted culpable homicide.

title: YouTube offers 'buyout' option to employees; read CEO Neal Mohan's memo to employees
content: YouTube is reorganizing its product teams to prioritize AI, with three new divisions reporting directly to CEO Neal Mohan. This strategic shift aims to accelerate the platform's AI integration. The company is also offering voluntary buyouts to select US-based employees, emphasizing no planned layoffs as it prepares for future growth.

title: 'Don’t have to be rich to pursue degree abroad': Indian student on studying in Canada
content: Indian student Saransh Ahuja shares his journey of studying in Canada without immense wealth. A UFV graduate in Computer Information Systems, he highlights practical learning, affordable living, part-time work, and scholarships. From adapting to independent life and building networks to securing a work permit post-graduation, his story offers a realistic, inspiring guide for aspiring international students.

title: Bengaluru horror: Delivery boy crushed after road rage spat; martial arts trainer, wife arrested
content: A Kalaripayattu trainer and his wife were arrested for allegedly murdering a food delivery agent in Bengaluru. Police claim the couple intentionally rammed their car into the agent's scooter after a minor collision, leading to his death. The couple was later seen returning to the scene to collect car parts.

title: Can heart attacks be inherited? What family history & genes mean for your heart
content: Heart disease in families is a warning, not a destiny. While genes play a role, lifestyle choices hold immense power. Knowing your family history empowers you to take control. Experts advise healthy eating, regular exercise, and quitting smoking. Regular health check-ups are crucial. Proactive steps can rewrite your health narrative.

title: Payroll pressure: Meta CFO flags rising salaries, AI talent pay a big cost driver
content: Meta's Q3 earnings revealed significant AI investment, with employee compensation driving costs.  The company anticipates spending $70-72 billion on AI infrastructure in 2025, aiming to stay competitive in the AI race. Despite beating revenue, net profit fell due to a tax charge, impacting stock.

title: Indian-origin man attacked, killed in Canada by stranger who was urinating on his car
content: A shocking incident in Edmonton saw Indian-origin Canadian businessman Arvi Singh Sagoo fatally assaulted after confronting a stranger urinating on his car. The unprovoked attack left Sagoo unconscious, leading to his death five days later. Police have arrested Kyle Papin in connection with the aggravated assault. A fundraiser has been launched to support Sagoo's two children.

title: Gold & silver price prediction: Will rates rally again? Here’s what investors should know
content: Gold and silver price prediction today: Gold and silver prices are poised for a potential upward trend. MCX Gold is expected to climb towards ₹1,25,000, supported by renewed buying interest. MCX Silver is also showing strong upward momentum, with potential to reach ₹1,55,000.

title: 'Getting better': Shreyas Iyer breaks silence after horror injury; thanks fans
content: Shreyas Iyer has broken his silence following a life-threatening spleen laceration sustained during an ODI in Sydney. The Indian cricketer, who was in the ICU, expressed gratitude for the overwhelming fan support as he recovers. The injury, initially thought to be a bruise, required immediate medical attention to prevent a fatal outcome.

title: Cloud disruption: Azure services restored; Microsoft reveals what went wrong and why
content: Microsoft's Azure cloud services have been fully restored after a widespread outage caused by a configuration error in Azure Front Door. The disruption impacted millions of users across critical platforms like Microsoft 365 and Outlook for several hours. Despite the incident, Microsoft reported strong Q3 earnings, highlighting resilience and continued growth.

title: Saudi's 'stadium in the sky': Separating fact from fiction
content: The stadium isn’t floating on a tower. It’s designed to be inside The Line’s vertical structure, part of a multi-level megacity that stacks entire neighbourhoods in layers. The stadium will occupy the fourth and fifth levels of this vast mirrored structure, making it high-altitude, but still fully enclosed.

title: ‘Mera purse chahiye’: Woman with toddler smashes window of train
content: A woman, frustrated after her purse was allegedly stolen and her complaint ignored by authorities on the Indore-Delhi train, violently smashed an air-conditioned coach window with a tray. Despite injuries and the presence of a child, she continued her outburst, drawing mixed reactions online regarding her actions and the authorities' response.

title: 'Because of other nations ... ': Trump orders nuclear weapons testing; move follows Russia’s trials
content: President Donald Trump has ordered the Department of War to begin testing United States nuclear weapons. This action is a direct response to nuclear testing programs conducted by other nations. The process is set to commence immediately. Trump stated the United States possesses the most nuclear weapons globally, a status achieved through upgrades during his first term.

title: Tragedy! Hit in neck by ball - Young cricketer dies during practice
content: A promising 17-year-old Australian cricketer, Ben Austin, tragically passed away after being struck by a ball during a practice session in Melbourne. The freak accident occurred while he was facing deliveries from a bowling machine. His local sporting community is devastated by the loss of the talented young athlete, with grief support being offered to his schoolmates.

title: Drake trolls Shohei Ohtani and Dodgers during Blue Jays’ World Series run
content: Global rap star Drake ignited World Series buzz with a cheeky Instagram post about Shohei Ohtani and the Dodgers, just as his beloved Toronto Blue Jays neared a championship. This viral move, following a surprise appearance at a game, highlights Drake's knack for blending music, memes, and baseball, keeping him central to Toronto's historic run.

title: 132 killed in Brazil’s deadliest police operation against drug gangs; how it unfolded
content: Brazil witnessed its deadliest police operation against drug gangs, claiming at least 132 lives in Rio de Janeiro. The extensive raid, aimed at dismantling the Red Command, saw residents recovering bodies. While authorities deemed it a success due to arrests and seizures, the high death toll has prompted an investigation into potential misconduct and federal support for forensic work.

title: Son of Darshan Singh Sahsi, killed in Canada by Bishnoi gang, speaks up
content: The son of Darshan Singh Sahsi, a prominent textile recycling company president, stated his father received no threats or extortion demands before being fatally shot outside his home in Canada. While police investigate a social media claim by the Lawrence Bishnoi gang linking the murder to an extortion denial and drug trafficking accusations, Sahsi's family remains baffled by the senseless violence.

title: SRK to bring in his 60th birthday at his Alibaug home
content: Bollywood's 'Badshah' Shah Rukh Khan is set to celebrate his 60th birthday on November 2 with a grand family and friends gathering at his Alibaug residence.  This milestone celebration, coinciding with his upcoming film 'King', is fueling speculation about a potential surprise reveal.  After a successful return to the big screen, SRK continues to reign supreme.

title: IMD predicts heavy to very heavy rain in 18 states; two regions put on alert
content: India braces for widespread rainfall and thunderstorms from October 30 to November 2, influenced by Cyclone Montha remnants and an Arabian Sea depression. Heavy to very heavy downpours are forecast for eastern, central, and parts of western India, with alerts issued for the northeast. Coastal regions are warned of squally winds and rough seas.

title: Cardiologist reveals why 35-year-old 'super-fit' men are more prone to heart attacks
content: Young, seemingly healthy men are experiencing sudden heart attacks, baffling cardiologists. Dr. Dmitry Yaranov highlights that extreme diets, inflammation, genetics, and lifestyle habits like poor sleep and stress can lead to heart issues, even with a fit physique. True heart health requires inner balance, diverse nutrition, and regular check-ups beyond just visible fitness.

title: IND vs AUS: 'He's doing a Kohli' - DK lauds Gill's calm dominance in rain-hit clash
content: Shubman Gill's composed 37 off 20 balls in the rain-hit T20I against Australia drew comparisons to Virat Kohli's efficient batting.  Former player Dinesh Karthik highlighted Gill's unhurried scoring and growing maturity.  Despite intense competition for T20 spots, Gill's leadership roles are boosting his confidence as India builds towards the T20 World Cup.

title: Convict in Nitish Katara murder dies in UP crash: Sukhdev Yadav killed months after release;
content: Sukhdev Yadav, convicted in the 2002 Nitish Katara honour killing, died in a road accident in Kushinagar just four months after his 20-year prison sentence ended. He was killed when a speeding car struck the motorcycle he was riding. His release was previously opposed by Katara's mother.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens below 26,000; BSE Sensex down over 200 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in red on Thursday on weak global cues. While Nifty50 went below 26,000, BSE Sensex was down over 200 points.

title: ‘Uber driver aa gaya’: Diljit reveals facing racist comments in Australia
content: After his arrival in Australia for the AURA World Tour, renowned Punjabi artist Diljit Dosanjh encountered hurtful online comments, branding him as just 'an Uber driver' or a '7/11 employee.' In the face of such slurs, Diljit maintained his composure, promoting a message of universal love and reflecting on his belief in a world free from borders.

title: New ‘common sense’ rule: US ends automatic work permit renewal; tightens immigration norms
content: New Trump administration rules will end automatic work permit extensions for migrants.  Applicants must now undergo fresh screening before their Employment Authorization Documents are renewed.  This aims to enhance vetting and deter fraud, ensuring only eligible individuals continue working legally in the US The change takes effect October 30, 2025.

title: Racy clips, blackmail and killings: The dark trail behind India’s ‘live-in murders’
content: Once a symbol of freedom, live-in relationships in India are now linked to chilling incidents of betrayal, violence, and death. From brutal murders to gruesome dismemberment, recent cases highlight a disturbing trend where possessiveness and jealousy escalate into extreme violence, challenging societal norms and legal interpretations.

title: Exclusive - Bigg Boss 19's Baseer Ali wants to maintain distance from Nehal Chudasama
content: Bigg Boss 19 contestant Baseer Ali expressed anger towards Nehal Chudasama after his eviction, citing clips where Nehal allegedly didn't defend him. He feels betrayed by her silence and wants to maintain distance. Baseer's mother also disapproved of the 'angles' and tagging with Nehal and Farrhana.

title: Michael Irvin: Cowboys legend gets emotional as wife fades to Alzheimer’s
content: Football legend Michael Irvin is bravely navigating a personal crisis as his wife, Sandy Harrell, battles very early-onset Alzheimer's.  Initially mistaken for menopause, the disease's subtle signs emerged a decade ago.  Irvin is now dedicated to ensuring Sandy's comfort and dignity at home, employing a 24-hour nurse and live-in caregiver, showcasing his profound devotion off the field.

title: Joe Rogan slams UFC’s no-standup rule, cites Khabib as perfect dominance
content: Joe Rogan reignited debate by advocating for a "no standup" rule in MMA, asserting grapplers must earn their way up. He lauded Khabib Nurmagomedov as a rare fighter who made grappling exciting and effective, consistently finishing opponents. Rogan also proposed removing the cage, believing it aids strikers. These bold ideas continue to spark discussion.

title: Tom Aspinall’s father hints at hidden truth after UFC 321 eye poke drama
content: Tom Aspinall's heavyweight title defense against Ciryl Gane at UFC 321 ended prematurely due to an eye poke, resulting in a no-contest. Aspinall's father criticized the UFC's safety protocols, suggesting profit drives action. Despite the controversy, UFC President Dana White indicated a swift rematch is likely, citing fighter health and fan interest.

title: Joe Alwyn’s message to Taylor Swift after engagement with Travis Kelce
content: Joe Alwyn is reportedly handling Taylor Swift's engagement with quiet grace, with sources close to him stating he genuinely hopes she's happy and has no plans to reach out. While Swift has moved on to a very public relationship, Alwyn has retreated into his acting career, focusing on his own path forward.

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock recommendations for today—check list
content: Top stock market recommendations: Nuvama Professional Clients Group's Deputy Vice President, Aakash K Hindocha, recommends ONGC, Graphite India, and SAIL as top buy calls. He anticipates Nifty and Bank Nifty to test all-time high levels.

title: High blood sugar may indicate kidney disease: Know causes, symptoms, prevention
content: High blood sugar signals kidney strain. Consistently elevated glucose levels damage kidney filters and blood vessels. This can lead to reduced kidney function and chronic kidney disease. Early detection through regular tests is crucial. Managing blood sugar and blood pressure protects kidney health. Lifestyle changes also play a vital role in preventing further damage.

title: Women’s WC semifinal: Yellow Watch in Mumbai! Will rain play spoilsport as India face Australia?
content: India and Australia's ICC Women's ODI World Cup 2025 semifinal faces potential rain disruption, with heavy morning showers predicted. However, forecasts suggest clearer skies by the afternoon, with a reserve day in place to ensure the match proceeds. If completely washed out, Australia would advance due to their higher group stage ranking.

title: Lions and Eagles players wow fans with epic Halloween transformations
content: NFL players from the Detroit Lions and Philadelphia Eagles showcased legendary Halloween creativity at their parties.  Lions players like Jahmyr Gibbs as Jeff Hardy and Jared Goff as Ratatouille's chef impressed, while Eagles stars like Jalen Hurts as a janitor and Lane Johnson as Hagrid also stood out. Both teams proved their flair for fun off the field.

title: US Fed cuts rate by 25 bps: Powell says economic outlook uncertain; Dec cut ‘not forgone conclusion’
content: The Federal Open Market Committee, led by Chairman Jerome Powell, has reduced the benchmark interest rate by 25 basis points to 3.75-4.00 percent. This move aims to bolster the US economy amidst tariff adjustments and assess the impact of the ongoing government shutdown.

title: 'They may send him at No. 11 next!': Ex-India opener slams handling of Sanju Samson's batting role
content: Former India cricketer Kris Srikkanth fiercely defended Sanju Samson, calling him 'unlucky' due to inconsistent batting positions despite strong T20 performances. Srikkanth highlighted Samson's success as an opener and criticised his frequent shuffling from No. 3 to No. 8. He believes Samson is now the automatic T20 World Cup wicketkeeper choice.

title: Hurricane Melissa: 25 dead in Haiti; river bursts banks, homes swept away
content: Hurricane Melissa's devastating passage through the Caribbean has resulted in at least 25 deaths in Petit-Goave, Haiti, due to severe flooding from the La Digue river. The catastrophic Category 5 storm also caused widespread destruction in Jamaica and Cuba, leaving thousands homeless and without power.

title: CSK have found Dhoni’s replacement? Young keeper pulls off ‘Thala’-like brilliance - Watch
content: Chennai Super Kings' young wicketkeeper-batter Urvil Patel impressed with a lightning-fast stumping reminiscent of MS Dhoni. He also showcased his batting prowess with a fighting century for Gujarat in the Ranji Trophy. Patel's performances highlight his potential to carry forward the Dhoni legacy.

title: What Cade Cunningham is building in Detroit
content: Cade Cunningham lost the ball on offense, but gets it back for the Pistons with a chasedown block . he had just become a first-time All-Star and the driving fo foe . his first postseason win since 2008 was in the playoffs .

title: NBA gambling scandal follows familiar Mafia playbook
content: the alleged connection between the mafia and two former NBA players began through a little-known intermediary . prosecutors allege the intermediary was Robert L. Stroud, 67, a 67-year-old Louisville man with a criminal history . in 1994, he killed a man during an evening playing cards and gambling at a home .

title: What Aidan Hutchinson's extension means, and which pass rushers are getting paid next
content: aidan Hutchinson has been a star for the team from day one . he finished second in the 2022 draft with a team-leading 9.5 sacks and a pro Bowl nod . the move means the franchise will have its best pass rusher for years to come .

title: MMA pound-for-pound rankings: A new UFC champion and an ex-champ enter women's top 10
content: former bantamweight champion Julianna Pea is back in the top 10 . former featherweight larissa Pacheco loses her eligibility because she has not fought in over a year . heavyweight Francis Ngannou has been replaced by two fighters .

title: Edgecombe overtakes Flagg as ROY favorite; what it means for betting, fantasy
content: VJ Edgecombe ( +110 ) has officially surpassed Cooper Flagg ( +115 ) as the favorite to win the NBA's Rookie of the Year, according to ESPN BET . he is off to an amazing start, averaging 22.3 PPG, 5.8 RPG, 5.5 APG, 3.0 3PG and 1.5 SPG through his first four games while helping the Philadelphia 76ers to a surprising 4-0 start .

title: DGCA to relax pilot duty time rules from November 1
content:
NEW DELHI: India will by Saturday implement relaxed flight duty time rules for pilots to ensure the cockpit crew operating flights are not fatigued. DGCA on Wednesday said the seven remaining clauses of revised flight duty time limitations (FDTL) would be implemented from Nov 1. Fifteen clauses of the relaxed rules were implemented on July 1, 2025. Pilots of big Indian carriers have long complained about punishing rosters and warned having fatigued pilots adversely impacts safety. "The implementation of (relaxed FDTL rules) has been undertaken in a structured and pha-sed manner, taking into consideration flight safety, operational feasibility, and overall dynamics of civil aviation operations," DGCA said.

End of Article

title: Stay off district judiciary, it's our domain: Allahabad HC to Supreme Court
content: 'Let HCs Frame Service Rules For Judicial Officers' brimmed over two-decade-long discontent over apex court framing service rules for state judicial officers . the high court told the supreme court to adopt a "hands-off approach" over the issue .
